intro: Uvifera paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Uvifera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments with rich, well-drained soil. Uvifera paraensis plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various small organisms.
